SEARCH
Package uk.msci.project.rsa

Class SigScheme

java.lang.Object
uk.msci.project.rsa.SigScheme
All Implemented Interfaces:
SigSchemeInterface
public abstract class SigScheme extends Object implements SigSchemeInterface
This abstract class provides a specialised framework for implementing a signature scheme using the RSA algorithm. It implements the SigSchemeInterface and provides concrete and standardised implementations of some of its methods, along with additional functionality specific to RSA-based signature schemes.

Key components are encapsulated within the class, allowing for a modular and extensible design suitable for various RSA-based signature schemes.

  • Constructor Details

    • SigScheme

      public SigScheme(Key key)
      Constructs a Signature scheme instance with the specified RSA key. This constructor initialises the RSA key components (modulus and exponent), calculates the encoded message length, and sets up the SHA-256 message digest as the default hashing algorithm.
      Parameters:
      key - The RSA key containing the exponent and modulus. This key is used for signature operations within the scheme.

    • SigScheme

      public SigScheme(Key key, boolean isProvablySecureParams)
      Constructs a Signature scheme instance with the specified RSA key and a flag indicating whether provably secure parameters are to be used. This constructor initialises the RSA key components, calculates the encoded message length, sets up the SHA-256 message digest, and sets the flag for using provably secure parameters.
      Parameters:
      key - The RSA key containing the exponent and modulus. This key is used for signature operations within the scheme.
      isProvablySecureParams - A boolean flag indicating if provably secure parameters should be used in the signature scheme.

  • Method Details

    • initialise

      public void initialise(Key key)
      Initialises the signature scheme with the given RSA key. This method sets the RSA key components (modulus and exponent), calculates the encoded message length (emLen), and attempts to set up the SHA-256 message digest as the default hashing algorithm.
      Parameters:
      key - The RSA key to be used in the signature scheme.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the SHA-256 hashing algorithm is not available in the environment.

    • encodeMessage

      protected abstract byte[] encodeMessage(byte[] M) throws DataFormatException
      Encodes a message according to concrete signature scheme.
      Parameters:
      M - The message to be encoded.
      Returns:
      The encoded message as a byte array.
      Throws:
      DataFormatException - if the signature format is not valid.

    • sign

      public byte[] sign(byte[] M) throws DataFormatException
      Signs the provided message using RSA private key operations. The method encodes the message, generates a signature, and returns it as a byte array.
      Specified by:
      sign in interface SigSchemeInterface
      Parameters:
      M - The message to be signed.
      Returns:
      The RSA signature of the message.
      Throws:
      DataFormatException - If the message encoding fails.

    • verify

      public boolean verify(byte[] M, byte[] S) throws DataFormatException
      Verifies an RSA signature against a given message. Returns true if the signature is valid.
      Specified by:
      verify in interface SigSchemeInterface
      Parameters:
      M - The original message.
      S - The RSA signature to be verified.
      Returns:
      true if the signature is valid, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      DataFormatException - If verification fails due to incorrect format.

      Parameters:

      S - The RSA signature to be verified.
      Returns:
      true if the signature is valid, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      DataFormatException - If verification fails due to incorrect format.

      Parameters:

    • I2OSP

      public byte[] I2OSP(BigInteger m) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Converts a BigInteger to an octet string of length emLen where emLen is the ceiling of ((emBits - 1)/8) and emBits is the bit length of the RSA modulus.
      Specified by:
      I2OSP in interface SigSchemeInterface
      Parameters:
      m - The BigInteger to be converted into an octet string.
      Returns:
      A byte array representing the BigInteger in its octet string form, of length emLen.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the BigInteger's byte array representation is not of the expected length or has an unexpected leading byte.

    • RSASP1

      public BigInteger RSASP1(BigInteger m)
      Calculates the RSA signature of a given message representative by raising it to the power of the private exponent as outlined by the RSA algorithm.
      Specified by:
      RSASP1 in interface SigSchemeInterface
      Parameters:
      m - The message representative, an integer representation of the message.
      Returns:
      The signature representative, an integer representation of the signature.

    • RSAVP1

      public BigInteger RSAVP1(BigInteger s)
      Facilitates the verification of RSA signature by raising it to the power of the public exponent as outlined by the RSA algorithm.
      Specified by:
      RSAVP1 in interface SigSchemeInterface
      Parameters:
      s - The signature representative, an integer representation of the signature.
      Returns:
      The message representative, an integer representation of the message.

    • getNonRecoverableM

      public byte[] getNonRecoverableM()
      Gets the non-recoverable portion of message as generated by adjusted sign method for signature schemes with message recovery
      Returns:
      signing process initialised non-recoverable portion of message

      public byte[] getRecoverableM()

      Returns:
      verification process initialised non-recoverable portion of message

    • setDigest

      public void setDigest(DigestType digestType) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, uk.msci.project.rsa.exceptions.InvalidDigestException, NoSuchProviderException
      Sets the message digest algorithm to be used for hashing in the signature scheme and automatically configures the hash size based on the type of hash and the "provably secure" flag
      Parameters:
      digestType - The type of message digest algorithm to be set.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - If the specified algorithm is not available in the environment.
      uk.msci.project.rsa.exceptions.InvalidDigestException - If the specified digest type is invalid or unsupported.
      NoSuchProviderException - If the specified provider for the algorithm is not available.
      IllegalArgumentException - If a custom hash size is not a positive integer.

    • setDigest

      public void setDigest(DigestType digestType, int customHashSize) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException, uk.msci.project.rsa.exceptions.InvalidDigestException, NoSuchProviderException
      Sets the message digest algorithm to be used for hashing in the signature scheme to the specified digest type. It allows setting a custom hash size for variable-length hash types (like Hash functions with MGF or SHAKE types) when the "provably secure" flag is not set. For fixed-size hash types, the method ignores the custom hash size and uses the default size.
      Parameters:
      digestType - The type of message digest algorithm to be set.
      customHashSize - The custom hash size, used only for variable-length hash types.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - If the specified algorithm is not available in the environment.
      uk.msci.project.rsa.exceptions.InvalidDigestException - If the specified digest type is invalid or unsupported.
      NoSuchProviderException - If the specified provider for the algorithm is not available.
      IllegalArgumentException - If a custom hash size is not a positive integer.

    • computeHash

      public byte[] computeHash(byte[] message)
      Computes the hash of the given message using the current message digest algorithm. This method updates the message digest with the given message and then completes the hash computation.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be hashed, represented as a byte array.
      Returns:
      A byte array representing the hash of the message.

    • computeShakeHash

      public byte[] computeShakeHash(byte[] message)
      Computes a SHAKE hash of the given message using the current message digest algorithm. SHAKE (Secure Hash Algorithm Keccak) is a cryptographic hash function that can produce a variable-length output, allowing flexibility in hash sizes, for example, SHAKE-128.

      The resulting hash is generated from the provided message.

      Parameters:
      message - The message to be hashed, represented as a byte array.
      Returns:
      A byte array representing the SHAKE hash of the message.

    • computeHashWithOptionalMasking

      public byte[] computeHashWithOptionalMasking(byte[] message)
      Computes a hash of the given message. The resulting hash can have a variable length if the currently set hash function supports an extendable output, such as SHAKE-128 or MGF1 with a fixed underlying hash function like SHA-256.

      If the hash function is not fixed-size and is set to MGF1 with SHA-256 or SHA-512, masking is applied to generate a hash of the specified size.

      Parameters:
      message - The message to be hashed, represented as a byte array.
      Returns:
      A byte array representing the hash of the message.

    • getHashType

      public DigestType getHashType()
      Returns the current type of hash function set in the signature scheme.
      Returns:
      The current type of hash function being used with in the signature scheme.

    • getHashID

      public abstract byte[] getHashID(DigestType digestType)
      Retrieves the hash ID associated with a given digest type.
      Parameters:
      digestType - The type of digest algorithm for which the hash ID is required.
      Returns:
      A byte array representing the hash ID associated with the specified digest type.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided digest type is not supported.
